alert.note: Alert for Kane (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 3:45PM MDT until August 14 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Kane County in southern Utah... * Until 845 PM MDT. * At 345 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in the upper headwaters of Warm Creek, Last Chance Creek, and many tributaries for both basins. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and normally dry washes. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... The outlets for these creeks in Lake Powell. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
